page.title: 01Stratton Audley
page.content: The block mainly contains the village & farms of the parish of Stratton Audley. Stratton Audley is basically an agricultural community, although recent developments in the village have also created a dormitory for surrounding towns. The farms of Stratton Audley Hall, The Willows, Pool Farm & Manor Farm are mainly arable (cereal crops). Elm Farm, West Farm & Oldfields Farm are mixed, with dairy & fatstock herds, some sheep & some cereal crops. The kennels to the south of the village are the home of the Bicester & Warden Hill Hunt. The residential developments, Cavendish Place, The Limes & the Manor, contain properties in the higher price bracket so most of the owners are company managers, executives etc, working in Buckingham, Bicester, Oxford, Banbury and Aylesbury.
